title: Restoring Firefox data from a computer that crashed
content: My old computer crashed but I have access to the entire hard drive on my new laptop. I'd like to restore Firefox on the new laptop exactly as it was on the old laptop (bookmarks, tabs, etc.). All of the help articles talk about restoring from a backup, but I never made a backup since I obviously didn't know my computer was going to crash. Which files do I need to access from old hard drive and move to my new hard drive so that everything looks the same as before? Any help would be appreciated.
creator: markmanassee

title: clicking on links in external app open Firefox with 2 different windows on Mac Os
content:
Hello !

I'm a Mac user with Mac Os Big Sur 11.4

When i click on a link in an e-mail on the app "Mail" or in other applications Firefox (89.0.2 64 bits) open the link in 2 different windows : (1 window for the link destination and 1 window for the firefox home page i've set)

I would like to have only 1 window opening when i click on the link.

I've checked on the net and tried the solutions i've found but nothing works...

If i use "Safari" instead of Firefox as my default browser it works properly.

Any idea or suggestions please ?

Thanks a lot for you help.

All the best,

Antonio

creator: tfhonly

title: Replacement of favicon by PLAY icons is not an improvement
content: From v.88 to v.89, the favicon in tabs with playable/playing content has been replaced by a play icon. It isn't an improvement to me but a downgrade to firefox awesome UI: Favicon is the main element that permits the fast identification of a tab, the fact that a new tab contains some playable content is not relevant enough to replace the favicon with a playable icon, and the fact that a tab is playing something also is not relevant enough to replace the favicon with a playing icon. Is there any customizable option that I've missed that could allow me to return to the old way of displaying playable/playing content? If not, might it be something coming in the next updates?
creator: paulportier

title: Glitchy/distorted images & text occasionally display on websites
content: I have problems similar to post 9months ago, "Glitchy/distorted text occasionally displays on websites". I get distorted images as well as text on various websites when I use Firefox as my browser on my desktop PC. Tried clearing cache etc but didn't help. Had PC company in to look: he said there is a (rendering) code browsers use to interpret what is presented to them, but most websites set their sites up with codes to work for Chrome and don't consider Firefox. His solution was to use Chrome to get round this. But I do prefer Firefox especially for Bookmarks as sidebar. Have saved screenshots from today, one badly distorted, then same screen but few minutes later with only minor problem with the text. Can't figure out how to attach them here as in a Word document not a picture file format! Thanks for any help.
creator: katyk

title: Upon startup Firefox crashes Windows 10 yielding BSOD
content:
Upon the subject action, Windows 10 takes a system/memory dump, sends it to Microsoft, and automatically restarts. Firefox appears to be initializing for about 3 seconds (after clicking its shortcut) and then the crash occurs. The display of the initial Firefox landing page is not obtained.

The blue screen of death (BSOD) has this message: KMODE EXCEPTION NOT HANDLED

Also, the networking software (NETGEAR) is rendered inoperable and must be re-installed upon Windows restart. Otherwise, my system is stable. Maintenance is regularly applied as it becomes available.

Device Specifications: - Device name: LENOVO-71C72702 - Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM)2 Duo CPU E8400 @ 3.00GHz 3.00 GHz - Installed RAM: 4.00 GB (3.25 GB usable) - Device ID: D607D8C6-79B8-48DA-BE03-F72C10EF4442 - Product ID: 00330-80000-00000-AA092 - System type: 32-bit operating system, x64-based processor - Pen and touch: No pen or touch input is available for this display

Windows Specifications: -Edition: Windows 10 Pro - Version: 20H2 - Installed on: ‎6/‎9/‎2020 - OS build: 19042.1081 - Experience: Windows Feature Experience Pack 120.2212.3530.0

Firefox was a delight to use. But now not so much, as it's unavailable as described above.

If anyone has a fix, or a suggestion for obtaining one, it would be gratefully appreciated. Thanks!
creator: wwolf1

title: Dark autocomplete popups/tooltips etc.
content: Basically my question is, are we going to get all the dark mode related stuff mentioned here: https://blog.nightly.mozilla.org/2021/06/23/these-weeks-in-firefox-issue-96/ on Windows? Thanks.

title: Searching through the adress-bar opens new Tab.
content:
A few moths ago, when you visited a website and then typed some new search-term in the address-bar, you used to be able to search right in that tab. Now a new tab opens up and you get moved there.

While programming, i search for a lot of stuff. Switch to Firefox -> Ctrl+L -> type search-term is the fastest way i found to search for whatever I need. Problem is: now my browser clutters itself by always opening new tabs instead of just reusing the one i don't need anymore.

So my questions would be this:

  1. Is it possible to restore the old behaviour of staying within your one tab?
  2. If there is some other shortcut that allows for searching without moving to a new tab?

(I also tried Ctrl+K and Ctrl+J. Both still open a tab when you already are on a website.)
creator: f.thaler

title: thumbnails/Images not showing
content: I honestly have no idea what the issue is, but Ive had this issue thats localized to this web browser where image files, and thumbnails will not load at irregular unpredictable intervals on at least 2 different sites. I dont know a whole lot about computers let alone code. but so far Ive emptied the cache, deleted all cookies, replaced/uninstalled my adblocker reset my router restarted the comp everything I can think of. using the network thing on F12 it came up with 2 errors NS_ERROR_ABORT, NS_BINDINGS_ABORTED I dont know what this means but im told it has something to do with java script I dont know. all I know is everything was working fine until today. Ive tried another web browser and it seems to work fine, but Id like to not permanently switch if I can help it
creator: snprscout

title: Tracciamento posizione di Google
content: Buongiorno! Da qualche giorno ho notato che quando avvio Firefox, avendo impostato Google come pagina iniziale, in quest'ultima mi compare un popup che mi chiede di esplorare i ristoranti nei dintorni di casa mia. Se accetto, Google indica esattamente la mia posizione sulla mappa ed evidenzia dei ristoranti nei dintorni (cfr. immagini allegate). La cosa è alquanto irritante, perché ho impostato Firefox con il massimo delle restrizioni sulla privacy e sull'antitracciamento, incluso il blocco della posizione (cfr. immagini allegate). Se aggiungo il fatto che utilizzo anche AdGuard e che alla chiusura di ogni sessione di Firefox eseguo CCleaner per eliminare qualunque cookie e/o cronologia, il problema diventa seriamente preoccupante... Capita solo a me o c'è qualcun altro che ha riscontrato la medesima anomalia? Sto sbagliando qualcosa nelle impostazioni della privacy e sicurezza di Firefox? Un grazie anticipato a chi mi fornirà qualche suggerimento in merito. Alessandro
creator: alessandrosilvestri.pd

title: Videos on most pages dont play
content:
Hello, i run a PC with a WIN 10 Pro N version since 2 weeks. Bevore i had the WIN 7 64 N version and everythink was nice. The win version on the istall-usb stick ist downloadet fresh from microsoft and my hard drive is formatted. The version of Firefox is 89.0.2 (64-Bit).

With Win 10 Pro N firefox couldn't play Videos on most platforms (vimeo, twitter, all player from bs.to...) youtube is the only page that works.

The videos don't run in save mode. I have look for a lot of help-pages for this proplem, nothing works(e.g. download file xxx from mikrosoft, install program xxx, disable addons, reinstall firefox; change xxx in firefoxsettings...). I have ask some friends to look and they didn't found anything (because of EIFOK/ PEBKAC/ PICNIC [choose yourself] ^^). I have test same pages in Edge and there the videos work perfect.

Vimeo says: "Fehler im Player Beim Player gibt es ein Problem. Wir werden versuchen, ihn so schnell wie möglich wieder betriebsfähig zu haben."

Some other pages shows me: "The media playback was aborted due to a corruption problem or because the media used features your browser did not support."

title: Autoplay is blocked even when Firefox is set to allow audio and video autoplay settings
content:
YouTube videos do not autoplay - I have to manually press play every time a new video starts. This is highly tedious because I use the miniplayer very frequently, and I have to close the miniplayer (I suppose I could skip this step), reopen Firefox, press play, reopen the miniplayer, and then repeat the cycle when a new video plays. I tried this with Microsoft Edge (which I hate with a passion), and didn't have this happen, so I'm pretty sure this is something with Firefox. Every time I tried to look this up, i never found someone with this issue, so I'm pretty sure it's something I did, and I can't figure out how to undo it ahah.

If anyone knows what I can do to fix this, help is appreciated.

Respect

title: Can't get rid of what I believe is hopefully just a super cookie and not malware or a trojan?
content: I put items in a cart on a website that I accessed through firefox. I did not sign into any accounts on the website and I did not purchase the items. I then cleared my cookies, cache, and offline data. Later on I went back to the website and wanted to put items back in the cart to re-price everything and discovered that the items were still in the cart from before. I cleared cookies, etc. again and the items were still in the cart. I then went to the website on Chrome and the items were still in the cart. Again, I did not sign into any accounts or anything. I never use Chrome. Just went straight to the website on Chrome and went to the cart and the items were there even though I didn't use Chrome to put anything in the cart. I then cleared cookies, etc. on Chrome and the items were still in the cart. I tried this on Edge and same thing. I have used Bitdefender, Malwarebytes, Hitman Pro, and CC Cleaner and no program is finding the malware or spyware or trojan or whatever this is. This is a well-known website that even has a facebook page. I messaged the webmaster and I posted on their facebook page and I'm being ignored. What is this and how do I get rid of it?
creator: trueheiressofslytherin
